messages.content:
You are an AI assistant specialized in analyzing web projects developed using PHP and the Laravel framework. I need to generate an OpenAPI Specification for a web project based on its backend source code. I'm now focusing on endpoint `/v1/media/{medium}` with method DELETE, and here is the relevant information I found:

1. In `app/Http/Controllers/Api/V1/MediaController.php`, `App\\Http\\Controllers\\Api\\V1\\MediaController@destroy` is implemented to process HTTP requests to `/v1/media/{medium}` with HTTP method DELETE.

I'll provide you with the contents of the files mentioned above, you have the option to execute additional Unix commands to gather more information if necessary, but you must not run the source code of the project, and your task is to generate a list of Parameter Objects (the value of paths.[endpoint].[method].parameters) in Swagger 2.0 format.

You need to think step by step and provide an explanation of your results first. Then, output exactly "the final generated result begins", followed by the list of Parameter Objects in JSON format. Do not include fields not mentioned above, and do not use references ($ref) in your output (try to obtain the structure by executing additional Unix commands).

function.name: run_command
function.description: Run a Unix command and get outputs in the project directory. You must not run any source code of the project.

message.content:
The endpoint `DELETE /v1/media/{medium}` is handled by the `destroy` method in `App\Http\Controllers\Api\V1\MediaController`. This method uses Laravel's implicit model binding to resolve the `{medium}` path parameter into an instance of the `App\Models\Media` model.

In Laravel, when using `Route::apiResource('media', MediaController::class)`, the URI parameter for the resource is singularized by default. For the resource "media", Laravel uses "medium". The controller method signature `public function destroy(Media $medium)` confirms that the expected parameter name is `medium`.

The parameter `medium` refers to the unique identifier (ID) of the media record to be deleted. In this project, `App\Models\Media` extends `Spatie\MediaLibrary\MediaCollections\Models\Media`, which uses an auto-incrementing integer as its primary key.

The generated parameter object describes this path parameter.

the final generated result begins
```json
[
  {
    "name": "medium",
    "in": "path",
    "required": true,
    "type": "integer",
    "description": "The ID of the medium."
  }
]
```
